page.title: 03NORTHHOUSE FARM, COMMONSIDE
page.content: THIS FARM EXTENDS TO 3,000 ACRES. IT IS TENANTED FROM THE BUCCLEUCH ESTATES THE RENT REVIEWED 3 YEARLY. THE FARMER EMPLOYS A SHEPHERD, STOCKMAN & TRACTOR MAN,WHO ALL LIVE ON THE FARM. A HORSE, 2 MOTORBIKES & A 4 WHEEL-DRIVE SUBARU TAKE THE MEN AROUND THE HILL. THERE ARE 2,000 EWES INCLUDING 800 PURE CHEVIOTS. THE REST ARE GREY-FACED & HALF-BRED. COWS & CALVES FROM THE HAWICK/JEDBURGH AREA ARE SUMMERED & DURING THE WINTER STIRKS GRAZE THE HILL. AREAS OF THE HILL HAVE BEEN RECLAIMED & DRAINED WITH PLASTIC PIPES IN ORDER TO INCREASE THE IN-BYE (ie NON-HILL), SILAGE PRODUCTION & FLOCK SIZE. GRANTS FROM THE EEC & DEPT OF AGRIC HELP! ELECTRIC FENCES SURROUND NEW ENCLOSURES-CHEAPER THAN DYKES! FODDER RAPE IS SOWN INITIALLY, TO FATTEN LAMBS, THEREAFTER GRASS FOR SILAGE IS GROWN. BARLEY IS GROWN TOO.
